alert.note: Alert for Imperial County Southwest (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Phoenix (Central Arizona and California Desert)
info.headline: High Wind Warning issued February 15 at 6:41PM PST until February 15 at 7:00PM PST by NWS Phoenix
info.description: ...WIND ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 AM PST WEDNESDAY... ...HIGH WIND WARNING WILL EXPIRE AT 7 PM PST THIS EVENING... ...BLOWING DUST ADVISORY WILL EXPIRE AT 7 PM PST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...West winds 25 to 35 mph with gusts up to 60 mph expected, then gusts up to 50 mph late in the evening. * WHERE...Southwest corner of Imperial County. * WHEN...Until 1 AM PST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Difficult driving conditions, especially for larger vehicles traveling along roads with crosswinds. Light, unsecured objects may become airborne. Minor tree damage possible.
info.instruction: A Wind Advisory means that sustained wind speeds of between 30 and 40 mph are expected, or wind gusts of between 40 and 58 mph. Winds this strong can make driving difficult, especially for high profile vehicles. In addition, strong winds over desert areas could result in briefly lowered visibilities to well under a mile at times in blowing dust or blowing sand. Use extra caution.
